name: Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The position of all piles shall be accurately set out and checked by a suitably experienced surveyor prior to installation
7.02.02 - Nature of Ground and Subsurface Conditions

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Constructor shall inform the Designer where circumstances indicate that ground and / or groundwater conditions differ from those presented in the reports, indicated on the Drawings or interpreted from proof bores.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The logging of selected piles shall also be undertaken by the Designer to agree with the Constructor in identifying the founding stratum.
Comments / Closeout Details - Add First Pile Hold Points Checksheet and / or Selected Logging Hold Points Checksheet as required.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Constructor shall keep an excavation log for each pile that records the types of materials encountered and the depths at which those materials were encountered and any groundwater levels and inflows inside the pile
Detail Materal Type and when it Chages - Type and Depth:
The Depth to the Founding Stratum (m)
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Constructed piles shall not deviate outside the tolerances, unless otherwise shown on the Drawings or as accepted by the Designer.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pumping from pile excavations are permitted provided the Constructor can demonstrate that the excavation has been sealed against further water entry (e.g. through sufficient keying into rock) or that the pile excavation is stable and will allow pumping to take place without ground disturbance below or around the pile.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Unless shown otherwise on the Drawings, each pile shall be in intimate contact with the ground over its full length.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On completion of the pile excavation and immediately prior to installation of the reinforcement cage Loose and / or smeared material shall be removed from the sides of the rock socket
Frequency - Prior to installation of the reinforcement cage

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On completion of the pile excavation and immediately prior to installation of the reinforcement cage Loose, disturbed and / or softened materials and any sedimentation shall be removed from the pile base
Frequency - Prior to installation of the reinforcement cage

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The reinforcement cage shall not be installed, nor concreting begin for any pile, until the as-built founding level of the pile, the condition of the rock socket (where relevant) and the condition of the pile base has been accepted by the Designer
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Permanent casings shall be installed in such a manner as to minimise any annulus between the outside of the casing and the in-situ ground.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The installed casing profile shall be circular, with a deviation from the specified completed pile diameter of not greater than +5%, –0% of the pile diameter and with no distortions, dents, gouges or similar.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - As a minimum, an up-stand of temporary casing of at least 1 m above existing ground level shall be provided to prevent material falling into and contaminating the pile bore prior to and during excavation and concreting works.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Prior to the temporary casing being extracted, concrete shall be poured to the pile cut-off level plus the minimum over-cast allowance plus an allowance for the volume of annulus created by the extracted casing.
Frequency - Prior to the temporary casing being extracted

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When the temporary casing is being extracted, a sufficient quantity of concrete shall be maintained within such that the pressure from external water or soil is exceeded and that the pile concrete is not reduced in section or contaminated.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The temporary casing shall be extracted whilst the concrete within the pile remains sufficiently workable such that the concrete is not lifted. The temporary casing shall be removed vertically without applying lateral force. The rate of extraction shall not exceed 1 m per 5 seconds. The time at which the temporary casing is extracted shall be recorded by the Constructor.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Temporary casings that are in contact with concrete and which are not withdrawn prior to the initial set of the concrete has taken place, shall be left in place and the Designer notified.
7.05 Concreting in Dry Conditions (Preferred) - (Pile Construction Card)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Where a dry excavation can be maintained and the depth of water at the base of the pile at the commencement of concrete placement is less than 25 mm, concrete may be chuted into piles and allowed to free-fall to the pile base by no more than 5 m and without striking the pile reinforcement cage.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Unless clearly not significant, the rate of groundwater inflow shall be measured prior to placing concrete. Concrete shall be placed using under water concreting techniques, unless otherwise accepted by the Designer, when The rate of groundwater inflow compared to the rate of concrete placement is such that more than 5 litres of groundwater per cubic metre of concrete could be incorporated into the completed pile, or when The depth of water at the base of the pile at the commencement of concrete placement is more than 25 mm.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The time taken between placement of the reinforcement cage and commencement of concreting shall not exceed 4 hours. Reasonable efforts must be made to achieve this requirement. Where this requirement cannot be reasonably met, then the Designer shall re-check pile cleanliness and, if deemed necessary, the Constructor shall re-clean the pile immediately prior to concreting.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card
7.06.02 - Concreting Under Water - Loss of Immersion of Discharge Pipe

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - When the immersion of the discharge pipe is lost during concreting (for example, to repair breakages or to remove a blockage), further placement of concrete shall not proceed unless The concrete into which fresh concrete is to be placed has maintained its workability, The discharge pipe is re-immersed sufficiently deep into the previously placed concrete, and No water or other contaminant is introduced into concrete that will remain below the final pile cut-off level. If these conditions cannot be met, concrete placement shall be suspended, the discharge pipe shall be removed and alternative measures shall be agreed with the Designer to form a sound pile.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card
7.07.01 - Cleaning of the Excavated Pile Bore

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Cleaning of the excavated pile bore, as specified in subsection 6.3.1 of this Specification, shall be completed immediately prior to the installation of the reinforcement cage.
Frequency - Each Pile Prior to the Cage Installation
7.07.02 - Cleanliness State of the Pile Excavation

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The Constructor shall confirm, prior to the commencement of concreting, that the cleanliness state of the pile excavation has been maintained at the level required by this Specification and no circumstances have arisen that could change the condition at the base of the pile.
Frequency - Each Pile Prior to the Commencement of Concreting
7.07.03 - Loose and / or disturbed material during pour

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - No loose and / or disturbed material shall remain along the sides of the pile excavation nor lie at the pile base when concreting is started, nor be permitted to fall into the concrete as concreting proceeds.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pile reinforcement cages shall be located centrally within the pile excavation, such that final concrete cover to the extremities of the reinforcement cages is not less than 75 mm at any location.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The heads of bored piles shall be over-cast by a minimum of 300 mm (concreting in dry conditions) / 1000 mm (concreting under water) above the cut-off levels.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Concreting shall commence in a timely manner following installation of the reinforcement cage to minimise the potential for water ingress and/or collapse of the hole and/or sedimentation on the pile base, all of which could adversely affect the performance of the completed pile. Where it is suspected that these adverse conditions exist, the Designer shall re-check pile cleanliness and, if deemed necessary, the Constructor shall re-clean the pile immediately prior to concreting
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The concrete in the upper 2 m of the pile is to be thoroughly compacted using vibrators.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The time period between commencement of pile excavation and completion of concreting shall not exceed 24 hours
Frequency - Concreting shall not exceed 24 hours
Reinforcing has been checked and conforms to the drawings included:
Bar Size & Grade, Lap Lengths, Lap Locations, Bar Supports, Bar Spacing, Cover
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Washdown all steel reinforcement prior to pouring concrete to remove salts.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pouring of any concrete must be inspected by the Engineer prior to further work being carried out in the area.
Frequency - 48 Hours Notice Prior to Each Occurrence
Water level in pile from top - Distance from top of casing (m)
Tremie pipe to elevation - Distance from top of casing (m)
Concrete top elevation - Distance from top of casing (m)

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - The delivery docket of each batch delivered certifying the mix designation, cement type, specified strength, slump, date, mixing time, water added during batching and maximum aggregate size.
Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Slump tests shall be taken for each delivery of concrete and the results recorded by the Contractor.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - A set of specimens for concrete tests shall consist of four specimens from each major pour of concrete, one of which shall be tested at 7 days and the remaining three at 28 days after casting.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pile heads shall be broken back to achieve A slightly convex profile so that the middle of the pile is nominally 25 mm above the average level at the perimeter of the pile and A Type B construction joint in accordance with standard NZS3109:1997.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - On completion of pile installation and prior to incorporating any piles into the permanent works, the actual pile locations and verticality shall be confirmed by a suitably experienced surveyor.
Frequency - 5 working days prior to incorporating any piles into the permanent works.

Acceptance / Conformance Criteria - Pile construction records shall be submitted to the Designer within 24 hours of completion of any particular pile. Copies of the records shall be retained on site and made available for inspection by the Designer as required.
Verifying Document - Pile Construction Record Card
Frequency - Within 24 hours of completion of any particular pile
